intro: Chytranthus, commonly known as the rock dandelion, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its upright, branched stems and heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. These plants are adapted to survive in harsh environments and are often used in traditional medicine.
